refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "focus-icon" void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, gpointer user_data); "move-cursor" void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, GtkDirectionType arg1, gboolean arg2, gpointer user_data); "select-icon" void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data); "text-changed" gboolean user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, gchar *arg2, gpointer user_data); "toggle-cursor-selection" void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gpointer user_data); "unselect-icon" void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data);

refsect2.title: enum GnomeIconListMode
gnome_icon_list_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new icon list widget. The icon columns are allocated a width of icon_width pixels. Icon captions will be word-wrapped to this width as well.
If flags has the GNOME_ICON_LIST_IS_EDITABLE flag set, then the user will be able to edit the text in the icon captions, and the "text_changed" signal will be emitted when an icon's text is changed.

If flags has the GNOME_ICON_LIST_STATIC_TEXT flags set, then the text for the icon captions will not be copied inside the icon list; it will only store the pointers to the original text strings specified by the application. This is intended to save memory. If this flag is not set, then the text strings will be copied and managed internally.

listitem.simpara: Width for the icon columns.
A combination of GNOME_ICON_LIST_IS_EDITABLE and GNOME_ICON_LIST_STATIC_TEXT.
a newly-created icon list widget

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_construct ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_icon_list_construct (GnomeIconList *gil, guint icon_width, GtkAdjustment *adj, int flags);
refsect2.para: Constructor for the icon list, to be used by derived classes.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Width for the icon columns.
A combination of GNOME_ICON_LIST_IS_EDITABLE and GNOME_ICON_LIST_STATIC_TEXT.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the adjustment to be used for horizontal scrolling. This is normally not required, as the icon list can be simply inserted in a &GtkScrolledWindow and scrolling will be handled automatically.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Adjustment to be used for horizontal scrolling.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_vadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the adjustment to be used for vertical scrolling. This is normally not required, as the icon list can be simply inserted in a &GtkScrolledWindow and scrolling will be handled automatically.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Adjustment to be used for horizontal scrolling.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_freeze ()
refsect2.para: Freezes an icon list so that any changes made to it will not be reflected on the screen until it is thawed with gnome_icon_list_thaw(). It is recommended to freeze the icon list before inserting or deleting many icons, for example, so that the layout process will only be executed once, when the icon list is finally thawed.
You can call this function multiple times, but it must be balanced with the same number of calls to gnome_icon_list_thaw() before the changes will take effect.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_thaw ()
refsect2.para: Thaws the icon list and performs any pending layout operations. This is to be used in conjunction with gnome_icon_list_freeze().

listitem.simpara: An icon list.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_insert ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_icon_list_insert (GnomeIconList *gil, int pos, const char *icon_filename, const char *text);
refsect2.para: Inserts an icon in the specified icon list. The icon's image is loaded from the specified file, and it is inserted at the pos index.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Position at which the new icon should be inserted.
Name of the file that holds the icon's image.
Text to be used for the icon's caption.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_insert_pixbuf ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_icon_list_insert_pixbuf (GnomeIconList *gil, int pos, GdkPixbuf *im, const char *icon_filename, const char *text);
refsect2.para: Inserts an icon in the specified icon list. The icon is created from the specified Imlib image, and it is inserted at the pos index.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Position at which the new icon should be inserted.
Pixbuf image with the icon image.
Filename of the image file.
Text to be used for the icon's caption.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_append ()
refsect2.para: Appends an icon to the specified icon list. The icon's image is loaded from the specified file, and it is inserted at the pos index.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Name of the file that holds the icon's image.
Text to be used for the icon's caption.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_append_pixbuf ()
refsect2.programlisting: int gnome_icon_list_append_pixbuf (GnomeIconList *gil, GdkPixbuf *im, const char *icon_filename, const char *text);
refsect2.para: Appends an icon to the specified icon list. The icon is created from the specified Imlib image.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Pixbuf image with the icon image.
Filename of the image file.
Text to be used for the icon's caption.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_clear ()
refsect2.para: Clears the contents for the icon list by removing all the icons. If destroy handlers were specified for any of the icons, they will be called with the appropriate data.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the icon at index position pos. If a destroy handler was specified for that icon, it will be called with the appropriate data.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Index of the icon that should be removed.
An icon list.
The number of icons in the icon list.
An icon list.
The current selection mode for an icon list.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_selection_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode for an icon list. The GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE and GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED modes are considered equivalent.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
New selection mode.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_select_icon ()
refsect2.para: Selects the icon at the index specified by pos.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Index of the icon to be selected.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_unselect_icon ()
refsect2.para: Unselects the icon at the index specified by pos.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Index of the icon to be unselected.
An icon list.
The number of icons in the icon list
An icon list.
A list of integers with the indices of the currently selected icons.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_icon_width ()
refsect2.para: Sets the amount of horizontal space allocated to the icons, i.e. the column width of the icon list.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
New width for the icon columns.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_row_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the spacing to be used between rows of icons.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Number of pixels for inter-row spacing.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_col_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the spacing to be used between columns of icons.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Number of pixels for inter-column spacing.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_text_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the spacing to be used between an icon's image and its text caption.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Number of pixels between an icon's image and its caption.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_icon_border ()
refsect2.para: Sets the width of the border to be displayed around an icon's image. This is currently not implemented.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Number of border pixels to be used around an icon's image.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_separators ()
refsect2.para: Sets the characters that can be used as word separators when doing word-wrapping in the icon text captions.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
String with characters to be used as word separators.
An icon list.
Index of an icon.
The filename of the icon with index idx.
An icon list.
Filename of an icon.
The index of the icon whose filename is filename or -1 if there is no icon with this filename.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_set_icon_data ()
gnome_icon_list_set_icon_data_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gnome_icon_list_set_icon_data_full (GnomeIconList *gil, int pos, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Associates the data pointer to the icon at the index specified by pos. The destroy argument points to a function that will be called when the icon is destroyed, or NULL if no function is to be called when this happens.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Index of an icon.
User data to set on the icon.
Destroy notification handler for the icon.
An icon list.
Data pointer associated to an icon.
The index of the icon whose user data has been set to data, or -1 if no icon has this data associated to it.
An icon list.
Index of an icon.
The user data pointer associated to the icon at the index specified by pos.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_moveto ()
refsect2.para: Makes the icon whose index is pos be visible on the screen. The icon list gets scrolled so that the icon is visible. An alignment of 0.0 represents the top of the visible part of the icon list, and 1.0 represents the bottom. An icon can be centered on the icon list.

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
Index of an icon.
Vertical alignment of the icon.
An icon list.
Index of an icon.

Whether the icon at the index specified by pos is visible. This will be GTK_VISIBILITY_NONE if the icon is not visible at all, GTK_VISIBILITY_PARTIAL if the icon is at least partially shown, and GTK_VISIBILITY_FULL if the icon is fully visible.

refsect2.title: gnome_icon_list_get_icon_at ()

listitem.simpara: An icon list.
X position in the icon list window.
Y position in the icon list window.
The index of the icon that is under the specified coordinates, which are relative to the icon list's window. If there is no icon in that position, -1 is returned.
An icon list.
The number of icons that fit in a line or row.

refsect2.title: The "focus-icon" signal

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, GtkDirectionType arg1, gboolean arg2, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-icon" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "text-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, gchar *arg2, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "unselect-icon" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GnomeIconList *iconlist, gint arg1, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
